website_summaries.verdict: This pole gets high marks on everything from its looks and feel to its lightweight, durable construction.
pros: Comes with a cap to protect the guides, as well as a pouch for storage
Cap on bottom unscrews for storage
Foam grip feels good in the hand
cons: Some reports of quality issues with both the pole breaking and the guides becoming unglued

customer_reviews.title: Broke on first use!
customer_reviews.text: This was ordered as a replacement to the one I bought that came with a reel. That first one broke after I hooked onto what appeared to be a large drum - but the rod broke and while I was dealing with that the fish got away. Thinking that it was perhaps due to the size of fish and perhaps an overly high drag setting I ordered this one. Unfortunately the same thing happened as with the first one, but this time with a smaller fish (~3 lb) which I actually landed despite the rod breaking not far above the reel. I bought this purely because of the portability but do not waste your money on this!
customer_reviews.author: Jay Rampersad

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality Telescopic Rods
customer_reviews.text: I can see why these rods are getting great reviews. I bought a 7.87' rod and I was so impressed with it, I purchased a 5.91' rod a day later. I was a bit worried about the quality of a telescopic rod, but these are fantastic graphite rods. The sections are loose until you pull them all the way out, so they give you a nice cap to hold the sections down when not in use. I bought both rods for ease of traveling and packing around, but I can see they'll become my go-to rods for most of the time. Comes with a so-so cover that that was unexpected and appreciated. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: lawdog

customer_reviews.title: Casts great!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve known about telescopic rods for years, my cousins in Italy use some that are amazingly long for their style of trout fishing. In Europe and Asia the top companies like Daiwa and Shimano offer some pretty amazing, high dollar telescoping rods, but for whatever reason the idea hasn’t really caught on here in the States. Even knowing all the above, I have mostly ignored these rods....until now. I bought the 8.8’ version, and I am sorry I never tried these until now. It is a great rod, with terrific action, and casts perfectly. Plus it shrinks down to less than 2 feet! Perfect for traveling by car or motorcycle, and tops for backpacking. Try one, you will be delighted.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Aveni

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality rod. Unfortunately nothing but issues
customer_reviews.text: Lasted 5 months.... guides came Loose had to reglue multiple times. Reel seat doesn’t fit reels and has play even when tightened very tight. Then one of the guides broke causing the guide insert to fall out Rendering it useless.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Like a Boy Scout. Prepared.
customer_reviews.text: Best scoop crop I've ever seen. Clean action. Perfect flex. I new the rod and reel combo (reel separate) in my back pack along with a small tackle box. Real small. Always be prepared to get your bait wet.
customer_reviews.author: Kouri

customer_reviews.title: Sougayilang Fishing Rod is not in the hunt.
customer_reviews.text: My Sougayilang Fishing Rod arrived today and I have never been so disappointed for a long time. Included in the description is surf rod but it is hardly that being to flimsy and light. The developers of this product need to properly re-evaluate the potential for this item....I would class it as light estuary or river fishing only. The worst part of the rod was the ferrules were not glued fixed in place. all of the ferrules shifted up and down and rotated on their respective shafts. It became a nightmare. Grossly disappointed in this product.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Turkovic

customer_reviews.title: A Truly Awesome Rod!!!
customer_reviews.text: An impressive quality rod at an even more impressive price!! I was so blown away by the quality and performance when paired with their incredible Baitcasting reel- that I bought a second larger rod for Surfcasting and Salt Water Trolling. It by far outclasses all of my existing mainstream brand rods and provided a much needed boost of excitement in my fishing routine. I can see this becoming my new long term "Go-To" rod. Compact and exquisitely crafted with premier level craftsmanship and materials. You won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Beard Beardington Esq. III

customer_reviews.title: great pole for the space.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great pole for the occasional fisherman such as myself. it is sturdy, well built and easy to use. it is very easy to collapse at the end of the day and the compact size stores nicely. the only two minor draw backs, which is why it lost a star, are that it has no hook on the back for your finger like some others do and the eyelets tend to get misaligned and the line sometimes gets tangled. over all it is a great pole and the compact size is great for storage. I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Tabor

customer_reviews.title: Absolute Garbage! Don’t buy!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to fish in Belize, caught a nice snapper the first time I used it. The second time the guides started coming loose (glued on) and the third time the rod tip snapped off while casting a small lure. Piece of trash! I can’t say enough how disappointing this rod is! Now I’m out of the country with a piece of trash broken rod. I was surprised at how cool it seemed at first for the price compared to other name brand rods but like the saying goes, if it seems too good to be true it probably is. Crap crap crap, don’t make the same mistake I did!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wow!
customer_reviews.text: Went up to Alaska with a few friends and was told to bring this for black bass. After our Halibut run we used these rods for the black bass. Catching black bass on these rods were amazing. Fun flight. This was my first time for black bass so I also tried black mass on a salmon rod. After the initial hit you couldn’t tell there was a fish on the line. Just a warning: take it out of your bag if it’s in your carry on, TSA in California has me open my bag but the one in Alaska were familia
customer_reviews.author: P. G.

customer_reviews.title: Was happy, then not....
customer_reviews.text: Two eyelets broke off the first week I used it. While it worked, it worked great. But construction is not solid. I have glued the eyelets back in place. I'm sure they will become lose again since they are only glued.
customer_reviews.author: My Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Great deal, good product.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great fishing rod for what it is and for what it costs. You will put this in your car, take in your travel bag, and actually use it! It casts well and feels good when reeling in a fish. I used it in saltwater with a 4500 reel to cast artificials both inshore and off the surf. It looks good too, and the overall finish is very nice.
customer_reviews.author: R. B.

customer_reviews.title: Rod tip was broken off completely upon arrival.
customer_reviews.text: First time this has happened. Rod tip was broken off when it arrived. Like the product. Sent one to my son 3000 miles away. Disappointed because he was very excited. Please help make it right. I really hate asking him or wife to run around dealing with this. Update. Increase to 4 stars. Amazon shipped a new one immediately. My son loves it. Keeps it in his work truck and tosses a few lures before heading home at one of the many lakes in his area. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: J. Jansen

customer_reviews.title: Good value and very portable
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased several of these, I really like them and they work great. I can take 5 of them in a small carryon suitcase. I have broken a few of them fighting big fish in Mexico. They are hollow and not meant for big game fishing but I was expecting that as the fish were huge. Great value, I use them for surf fishing for Perch in Southern California all the time
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Broke.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 2.1 and the first time i opened it the top 2 eyes were broken off :( Really disappointed because it seems like it would have been an awesome rod. I usually have my dog with my and to be able to fit a rod in my bookbag is a dream come true. For the price I am just gonna try to fix it myself.
customer_reviews.author: Mttol

customer_reviews.title: First of all, I bought this on a special ...
customer_reviews.text: Junk! First of all, I bought this on a special Amazon Prime shopping day where "deals" were supposed to be 65 - 70% off. I should have done more checking. My "deal" was only about $2 less than it could have been bought almost anywhere. I gave it to my son for Christmas. He hooked one fish with it, which broke the rod in half. Not a big fish either. This rod is a piece of junk. I was so embarrassed to have given him such an inferior rod that I went out today and purchased a replacement from a reputable brand. Lesson learned. The entire purchase was a scam!
customer_reviews.author: Terri

customer_reviews.title: Was great until it broke...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pole less than 2 years ago, and have only used it 5-6 times while bass fishing. It worked great and I love how portable it is. However, on a recent vacation I snagged a log underwater. While trying to get my line back, the pole snapped in half!! Would have thought some 10 lb test line would break before the pole. Sad to say I can't recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Hickerson

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. I set this up with a basic fluke ...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I set this up with a basic fluke rig with braided line and a 2 ounce weight to see if I could launch it for some surf fishing. I was under a bridge and shooting it right between the pilars. Great product so far. I've read that it snaps after casting too many times but I purchased the 2.4M/7.87 ft. pole and I think this one won't snap but we'll see. I had over 50 casts that day and it was all good. If it ever snaps I'll update this review.
customer_reviews.author: David J. A.

customer_reviews.title: I love the appearance
customer_reviews.text: I love the appearance, quality, and flex of my new 2.1m rod. I look forward to using it tomorrow. Two small points but they could matter down the road. The bag to protect the rod is very flimsy--it appears to be made of cellulose rather than any substantial fabric. And the fastening strap for the guides cover looks like it will snap after a bit of use. I'll update this review after I have some experience with the rod itself.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Eisner

customer_reviews.title: nicely made, it not SUPER high quality and if ...
customer_reviews.text: does what i need much more than what i was thinking, nicely made, it not SUPER high quality and if you treat is right will do just fine needed something that would be easy to keep in the car and have a nice length for casting, perfect for what I was looking for
customer_reviews.author: joe

customer_reviews.title: Light weight and strong.
customer_reviews.text: Update September 5 2018. Selling contact me about the problem and make it right. Very happy right now. Any issue contact sell. They are friendly and willing to talk about the issue. The product is nice and light and seem to be strong. Too bad that the guild ring come off within hours of opening. They didnt glue the ring too well and it come off. So disappointed.. I had high hope on fishing with it this weekend.
customer_reviews.author: Minh Bui

customer_reviews.title: It's an amazing pole. Now I just gotta find a good ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this rod knowing what to expect. I will tell you u got more than i expected. When I first extended it I I was surprised how light the action was. I thought the rod was going to be stiffer due to the joints. I attached a cheap zebco reel to it and tried a few casts in the back yard. Everything was smooth. I have only taken it fishing once and only got a small croaker but I instantly felt the bite. It's an amazing pole. Now I just gotta find a good matching reel. This will be my quick go to pole. Convenient and effective.
customer_reviews.author: Al reviews

customer_reviews.title: Base of rod is well made but poorly made at tips.
customer_reviews.text: I own several collapsible fishing rods and have other sougayilanh items so I thought this would be a good deal. Unfortunately, this rod broke as I extended it for the very first time. Obviously disappointed since I was planning to use it today.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Brooks

customer_reviews.title: Reliable, and space free rod
customer_reviews.text: I like the fact that I can have this rod placed on my small bag for beach trips, and it occupies a small amount of space. I have bought a 9 footer rod. However I already went on six fishing trips and I haven't had any issue with the rod itself. So far its proven to be sturdy, reliable, and fair for its price. Near the future I'll would probably buy another one, but I wish it would come with a good spool.
customer_reviews.author: MarioA.Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Great looking rod, with a few flaws
customer_reviews.text: Got the rod almost a year ago. I never got to use it until I went on vacation this past May. After the first day of using the rod, I had to buy a new rod. Half of the line eyelets had come loose and would no longer stay in place. It was such a shame, that the rod didn’t even last a day. It looked great visually, and the rod seemed to be pretty well constructed, except for the line guide eyelets. I think that the eyelets were just designed bad, as they were very bulky at the base where they wrapped around the rod. I also think whatever adhesive they used for them, was just not good enough.
customer_reviews.author: Rich R

customer_reviews.title: great rod for the price
customer_reviews.text: This rod is great for the price. best thing about it is it's portability. on problem i found is that the second to last ring got loosed and moved freely p on down the rod. i fortunately got it fastened back to where it was and now the rod functions like normal. had it not been for this i would have given it 5 stars. But hey for this price it cannot be perfect. But for the price it out performs my expectations and is very strong and sturdy. if your new budget fisherman like me this would be the best option for you
customer_reviews.author: Lonzo Wilkinson

customer_reviews.title: somewhat heavy of an action for graphite rod and actually pretty heavy. They say this can be used for ...
customer_reviews.text: Just got this rod. Seems ok for now, but, somewhat heavy of an action for graphite rod and actually pretty heavy. They say this can be used for both freshwater and salt water, but, really i feel like the rod is designed to be saltwater rod. The bottom is heavy so makes the casting of light lures rather challenging. Still, for the price, the product seems decent. Only had the rod for 2 weeks, and went out fishing with it only twice, so I may come back later for different review.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Everyone kept telling me it was a garbage powl to fish with on the beach
customer_reviews.text: Brought it to Mexico Beach. Everyone kept telling me it was a garbage powl to fish with on the beach, but I caught ~30 fish that weekend. Sure many of the fish were 5-9 inches and weighed little, but I did catch a few 13-15 inch fish and a baby blacktip shark. This pole took it all like a champ with ZERO issues. It's my new favorite pole at the moment.
customer_reviews.author: Kyosji

customer_reviews.title: My Pole Snapped in Half
customer_reviews.text: On my third outing with this pole, it snapped apart at the third rung. I have been fishing for many years, and I've never had this happen to me before. I was using 8 lb line and trying to untangle a snag, like I've done hundreds of times in my life. Additionally I lost my $10 lure. I really wanted to like this pole because it is light, and fit nicely in my backpack. Unfortunately I can't rate it more than one star because I can no longer use it. I will obviously rate this higher if I can get a replacement pole, but to say I'm disappointed is an understatement.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Helmke

customer_reviews.title: Good! Specially for this price.
customer_reviews.text: Never had any luck before with telescopic rods, maybe with an exception of my Tenkara rod. I broke all of them, but I always wanted to have one for my backpacking travel. I have several travel rods (4-6 pc), including all my fly rods, but they are still bulky if you prefer light travel without checked-in laguage. This one made me very happy this Christmas. I was able to fish with it from the boat and do plenty of surf fishing as well. 15lb wahoo was landed on the beach in Ecuador with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Gary I. Pasternak

customer_reviews.title: Not durable
customer_reviews.text: This rod worked well at first, and I really loved the portability of it when collapsed (hence the 2 stars instead of 1), but only after a few uses through one year, the tip broke completely off during light use. The piece that holds the reel in place would also come loose often during fishing, having to constantly tighten it. Would not recommend. I will be picking up a more traditional rod next. Update (8/19/2018): I contacted the seller and since I was within the 1 year warranty period they sent me a new one. Upgraded to 4 stars given the customer service. Will see how this one lasts.
customer_reviews.author: DShin

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: Not sure about the telescoping part, just because have never used one and wondering if will tend to "re-fold" when reeling on in. Plus, it's a pain to re-fold some sections, smaller - at the end - seem like they might break from the force needed to push back together.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Tripper

customer_reviews.title: Great feel overall
customer_reviews.text: Great feel overall. Didn't give it a 5 because the plastic part of the handle has sharp angled edges that aren't the most comfortable. Otherwise worked well and is very convenient for keeping stashed in my truck for any "emergency" fishing. While I recommend this rod, I did not have as much luck with their reels. Spend $5 more and put an AG Black Max 10 or even a cheaper Quantum Matrix on there.
customer_reviews.author: scot

customer_reviews.title: ruined my trip
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 of these for a family trip. Thought they would be perfect because they fit in the luggage. Well one of them broke on the very first cast with a jig. On the other rod, one of the line guides came loose from the section it was mounted on. So no useable rods on my trip to Florida.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: convenient travel rod.
customer_reviews.text: As an avid fisherman, my husband loves to fish anywhere he goes. He has been wanting a fishing rod that can fit in his carry on bag. This rod is perfect for the purpose. For such a great price, we found the rod study and flexible. The body and the line guides are of good quality. He already got many inquiries about this rod from interested friends and pass-bys.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy

customer_reviews.title: A quality rod - not perfect but great value for the price
customer_reviews.text: I chose the longest. I love the fact that it is telescopic. It casts a mile, it is very light. The last (tip) segment could use an additional ring, to make the action smoother and avoid the disturbingly frequent formation of knots around the tip. Don't exaggerate with the weight, and always cast with a circle motion, otherwise it will snap.
customer_reviews.author: Admiral Jack

customer_reviews.title: The best ever. I catch halibut, stripped bass and sting rays.
customer_reviews.text: I love this rods, I have caught halibut and stripped bass, they are super strong and even catch sting rays, the biggest one I’ve ever catch is about 40 lb and this rods hold like champion. I will buy this for all the times because they are simply the best ever.
customer_reviews.author: manuel reyes

customer_reviews.title: Good rod for the money
customer_reviews.text: Used this rod when traveling to Florida. Caught lots of fish and even a medium sea turtle off the surf. Rod is easy to break down and was strong enough for everything I caught. I was also casting 5 oz sinkers on steel leaders 50 yards out, easily with the 9 footer. Good rod for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: broke first time i used it..
customer_reviews.text: Rod broke the first time i used it and i had read a bunch of reviews on other sites, so it seemed like a good choice, trying to return it , but my printer broke, couldnt print return label, i just gave up and threw it out.
customer_reviews.author: macaroni

customer_reviews.title: Movable eyelets are useless
customer_reviews.text: The weight And length were nice but I didn’t like the moveable eyelets. Because they move my line kept getting wrapped around my pole and I had to keep realigning the line. They are useless and I may end up removing them.
customer_reviews.author: James B. Schiffer

customer_reviews.title: It will do for saltwater, but not ideal for finesse bass fishing.
customer_reviews.text: The rod is not very sensitive but I did not expect it to be. It seems better suited for medium game salt water fish than bass fishing. It could also use a traditional hook keeper rather than just using the metal holes on the handle. Not recommended for panfish and would probably only use it if I was backpacking, salt water fishing, or sneaking into golf ponds for hawgs :P.
customer_reviews.author: jose

customer_reviews.title: great for fish under 10pds
customer_reviews.text: For what it is and price its great. Used it to pull up 7pd catfish no problems.. until about 2 months of use and the 2nd piece down snapped i had a catfish that got tangled up in a bunch of weeds that added a lot more weight. Little disappointed but is what it is
customer_reviews.author: Michael8899

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Cast. Pieces falling off
customer_reviews.text: This thing is terrible at casting, I could see myself using it to hike up to a creek and drop a line in, that's about it. On top of that, the hoops keep falling off. This thing is pretty garbage but I might keep it just in case of emergencies or something. I definitely regret this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: Not durable
customer_reviews.text: Very top ring/eye got detached from the rod on my 3rd day of fishing with it. The rod itself seems to be of a good quality however there is no point of having it if the rings break apart that easily due to terrible weld job.
customer_reviews.author: AroundAbout

customer_reviews.title: Reel seat is poorly designed
customer_reviews.text: I didn't expect too much for the money and just wanted a cheap telescoping rod. I was not disappointed initially with the quality, except that none of my spinning reels fit snuggly when tightened onto the seat, leaving a lot of side to side play. This is extremely irritating while trying to fish. I rigged up a way to keep the reel on better by wrapping it with a strip of bicycle inner-tube and electrical tape, but it is definitely not ideal. Seems like a pretty serious defect to me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Broke on first cast
customer_reviews.text: Cant handle even a slight cast, mine has to be defective. First cast and the rod completely snapped in half. Was disappointed as the rod looked like it was pretty decent for the price. Luckily I had a spare rod to continue fishing for the day. Just loved the portability of the collapsible one though.
customer_reviews.author: HaydenBacon

customer_reviews.title: 3 years in still working and looking good
customer_reviews.text: Mostly river fishing, but recently some surf fishing has been going on nearby during quarantine and what surprises me is that this rod is still holding up after 3 years and not rusting or falling apart. I really like this rod. Portable and durable.
customer_reviews.author: Danny T Heck

customer_reviews.title: Weak eyelets
customer_reviews.text: I had the 6 foot rod and that worked fine so I decided to try this 8ft rod but one of the eyelets became unglued within minutes. The eyelet started spinning around the rod and wrapped my line around it. The rod itself is very light and sturdy but the eyelets need improvement
customer_reviews.author: Vircepts

customer_reviews.title: This is going to increase how much I fish.
customer_reviews.text: Feels solid while casting, but telescopes to like 18" for travel. I like throwing this in my secret spot in the trunk. The telescoping part is also nice when you are walking a long way to a spot or going through an area with a lot of trees to avoid those walking snags.
customer_reviews.author: LBCM

customer_reviews.title: Great for traveling and kayak fishing.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased July 2017 and used for kayak fishing and when traveling. Paired with Abu Garcia OrroS it has worked perfect for me. I've hooked some big fish and gotten hung up, bent the rod enough I was afraid it would break and it hasn't! I'm still loving this rod!
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: Great idea kind of gimmick haven't been able to use it much in the field
customer_reviews.text: Be careful don't extend it with too much force or it'll get stuck like mine did and I have not been able to fully collapse it. Another words do not extend with casting motion.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Rod broke first use
customer_reviews.text: Rod broke the first day using it. Was using with 6lb mono and it snapped at second section from top when trying to pull loose a snag. My line didn’t break, but the rod did. Rod is rated for 10lb line...
customer_reviews.author: Norse Rider

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: This pole is perfect. I took it in my suitcase with no damage upon arrival. The telescoping sections easily slide into position and stay there. It is lightweight but strong. I have started using it at home. I began using it on a full time basis. It fits easily into my fishing tackle backpack which I keep in my car. The action is great for panfish to big bass. The pole fits securely in my kayak. I am probably going to order another since I like to have at least 2 poles ready for different baits. I can’t think of one negative comment, it’s that good.
customer_reviews.author: dorothy ann Pollock

customer_reviews.title: Beware
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for portability and as a backup for family/friends who want to fish. I didn't expect much but I wasn't expecting it to break on the first few casts! I would estimate the fish was maybe 12lbs max. I don't know if the pole had defects, but I can't recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Lee

customer_reviews.title: Went fishing around four times with this rod, it ...
customer_reviews.text: Went fishing around four times with this rod, it is sensitive and light weighted. I owned few fishing rod value around $70 from Henry's Sports and Bait. This rod is more sensitive and allows me to pick up on very small bites. Casts more on average and the price is very decent.
customer_reviews.author: Christy

customer_reviews.title: Easy to have in you truck or in your car
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice telescopic fising pole cant ait to use it. Feels like it will be nice and have lots of action when fish are on the hook. It seems a little big for a telescopic fishing pole im use to smaller ones that can fit in your tackle box or in a backpack. Thad
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Looks and feels like pretty good quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: Havent used yet. Looks and feels like pretty good quality for the price. I ordered the 6 ft but received the 8 ft. rod. Im glad actually. Will order 3 more 8 ft. rods. Seems good for saltwater shore and shallow reef fishing.
customer_reviews.author: Dale Grible

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprised!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have always thought that telescopic rods were junk. I decided to try this one and have been very pleasantly surprised. I have hooked into some large fish in the San Francisco Bay and this rod works fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Edward J. Mack

customer_reviews.title: I'll hit it with some Gorilla Glue and it should be fine. Just an annoyance
customer_reviews.text: So after about 20 uses, the end eyelet came off. I was able to get through the day by inserting a piece of fishing line and jamming it back on the end of the rod. I'll hit it with some Gorilla Glue and it should be fine. Just an annoyance. It is a great value.
customer_reviews.author: Colorado John

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy it will fall apart
customer_reviews.text: I bought for my son, the first time he used it the line clips came lose, first one then more and then the top tip came off.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: not worth it
customer_reviews.text: i did not like the fact that the second day that i used it, the top guide eye became detached then an hour later the rod snapped while in mid cast, i cannot ever recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: tony

customer_reviews.title: Pretty stiff action, medium I'd say.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after quite a bit of searching online for a decent telescopic rod that wasnt junk. It's a pretty stout rod, much stiffer than I was wanting but it is usable. The grams system throws me off but after yard casting it with a 1/4oz panther martin and 5/8oz buds, I'd say that's where it belongs. More of a medium action. The handle is not very comfortable. Oh well. It does appear pretty tough and I think itll work.
customer_reviews.author: Y. Inong

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 3 months of light use
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately the rod broke after 3 months of light use. It snapped half way down. I’m curious if the brand will replace it. We shall see. Either way, it’s unreliable and I am hoping it’s just a defect.
customer_reviews.author: ChrisFix

customer_reviews.title: Weak connected part
customer_reviews.text: After I opened the box, I tried to check the full size of the fishing rod, but one of the connected part were broken. The connected parts are not made well and it's easily broken. So, I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Not long enough for a 5000 size reel
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 6.9 ft rod to pair with a Penn Battle II 500 reel, but have to replace it because the reel keeps bouncing whenever you are reeling - think is because the first section is not long enough so the first round thing that the line goes through is too close to the reel.. Haven't been able to test the durability and other aspects of the reel, but looks good overall (despite being very lightweight and thin).
customer_reviews.author: Eduardo

customer_reviews.title: Such a cute idea to carry with you everywhere. If you've ever thought " if I'd just brought a fishing pole!"
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a gift for my husband. It seemed like the ideal thing to always carry with you. Like an umbrella....small..and if you carry a lure, and happen to find yourself by some creek or pond..you have a fishing pole with you all the time! He loves it!
customer_reviews.author: WVHomegirl

customer_reviews.title: Good but could be better
customer_reviews.text: I had to add some adhesive to reinforce the points that the line guides attach to the rod. Aside from that, the rod works great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Meh... okay
customer_reviews.text: Was excited for this product but once shipped it wasn’t all it was hyped up to be. Great for small game and for on the fly fishing but not my go to.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Great product and even better customer service!!
customer_reviews.text: Great product, worked well and was very compact. Fit the reel no problem and before we could use on the water-my son broke it. I asked the seller how to fix or if they sold a kit to fix a section. I was informed they would replace it at no cost. Now that is customer service!! I truly appreciated the great support and customer service. That does not exist anymore and is really hard to find in an online retailer. Thanks so much!!!
customer_reviews.author: John P.

customer_reviews.title: This fishing rod will break
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one...it broke. I haggled with the seller to send me a replacement...over and over they would reply, "we will send you a replacement". I kept at them and finally received a second product. This one broke first cast. Product is garbage. Seller is shady. Spend your money somewhere else.
customer_reviews.author: BBB

customer_reviews.title: Fun rod, great seller.
customer_reviews.text: Top loop broke off after 6 months of light use. Rod wasn't mishandled. I'm not sure what happened as it was just gone one day. I contacted the seller and they were quite responsive, and shipped me a new rod after they saw a photo of the broken one.
customer_reviews.author: brb

customer_reviews.title: Don't use it in saltwater.
customer_reviews.text: Two of the the line guides came unglued the first time it saw saltwater. Junk.
customer_reviews.author: R.M.P.I.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect hiking / Fishing rod small enough to hike up ...
customer_reviews.text: Keep in mind I've only used this product once so far. Perfect hiking / Fishing rod small enough to hike up small trails, not get your rod stuck on anything in the way. At the same time strong / smooth when casting. Looking forward to using this much more this summer!
customer_reviews.author: Lk

customer_reviews.title: Build quality seems good so far
customer_reviews.text: I bought the shortest of these rods offered- 5'6" model. Tried it out briefly in a small local pond. Build quality seems good so far. One critique is that action is a bit heavy for such a short rod, maybe medium-heavy. It may prove too heavy for my intended purpose of "small water" backpacking rod.
customer_reviews.author: James Moore

customer_reviews.title: expected better quality
customer_reviews.text: i like that it's collapsible and easy to transport, but it feels cheap and isn't balanced. all in all for the price you can't really complain.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonAddict

customer_reviews.title: Very Durable Telescoping Rod
customer_reviews.text: This is the most durable telescoping rod I’ve used. I plan on buying a few more to replace a couple of Shakespeare telescoping rods that broke after barely any use.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Dyer

customer_reviews.title: Nice rod for carrying on my fishing vest
customer_reviews.text: Nice rod for carrying on my fishing vest. I only wish the first eyelet coming off the real was a bigger diameter. Would make for a smoother retrieve! Didn’t catch any fish. But tossed a bunch of lures and I’m happy with the operation!!
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: The fisherman is happy about it.
customer_reviews.text: As a frequent-fishing fisherman, my uncle loves it and still uses it a year after I bought this to him (along with another Sougayilang fishing pole I bought him). I guess the quality comes from this brand is good?
customer_reviews.author: try to be a smart shopper

customer_reviews.title: Tip fell off on first fishing trip
customer_reviews.text: It is heavier than expected. Parts seemed sturdy, but tip appeared not to be glued on.
customer_reviews.author: D. Heuschele

customer_reviews.title: also it’s held up by super glue. The rings that is
customer_reviews.text: Rings broke off during collapsing. Uhh yah... also it’s held up by super glue. The rings that is. Regarding the action. There is very little.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff D.

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done. Good travel option.
customer_reviews.text: Telescoping rods are not that great in general so know what to expect, this is a specialty rod for travel not your every day rod. I flew to California and fished these rods vety hard for a week 9ft and 7ft. They work well for non finesse fishing styles. I. E. Throwing bait in the surf or catfishing with a 1 to 3oz. Weight. The rods travel well are made from respectable materials and didn't fail. They are no magic bullet to replace real tacle options. But for an airplane/cross country family visit with alot of fishing mixed in- its just what the Dr. Ordered. Solid rod choice for less than ideal fishing/traveling options.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for any type of fishing.
customer_reviews.text: I took this with me on a cruise which was the best idea ever. It's a really lightweight and man it can handle some BIG fish. Definitely would recommend for any type of fishing.
customer_reviews.author: Gage

customer_reviews.title: Broke immediately, but good customer service - sending me a replacement
customer_reviews.text: Broke immediately after about an hour on the river. I snagged a log at the bottom and, as I began attempting to jiggle the hook free, it snapped with surprisingly little tension right above the middle joint. UPDATE: The vendor has been wonderfully helpful in providing me with a replacement rod. We'll see if the second fairs any better than the first, but I appreciate the great customer service!
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: TRASH
customer_reviews.text: Tip of this rod is way too thin and breaks almost instantly. Were it not for that it would be pretty decent for impulse fishing.
customer_reviews.author: W. Howell

customer_reviews.title: very happy with rod
customer_reviews.text: Given the price, very happy with rod. You need to know what you are getting, this is more like a medium heavy rod. It is a bit stiff and not as sensitive as some of the lighter rod. Pulling two pound fish from under the bridge without much effort. So far it is holding up.
customer_reviews.author: I Fisherman

customer_reviews.title: Needs to be more durable.
customer_reviews.text: Bought a few of these the past few years to give them an honest review. I've had 4 break on me doing the minimal of force applied. From getting lures unsnagged to even a break. In mid cast. Comply needs to step up durability.
customer_reviews.author: Androsian

customer_reviews.title: Good rod...broke
customer_reviews.text: It's hard to give 2 stars, but since it is in two pieces I have no choice. Before I broke it (caught on a lilly pad and snapped) this was a great rod. Collapsed nice and held form when extended. It was a little stiff for my liking.
customer_reviews.author: Nich

customer_reviews.title: DONT BUY, buy a name brand...
customer_reviews.text: WOW!! Cheapest rod EVER!!! Not even 3 casts in the rod SNAPPED on my first hookset... Lost the fish btw.. don't buy this rod at all!!! I have never been so dissatisfied with a product. Save your money and buy an actual brand name. I was hesitant to buy but wanted to give it a chance. Now I know why I didn't before...
customer_reviews.author: A SOSA

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed with this rod
customer_reviews.text: Everything about this collapsible rod as exceptional. I recommend. Only thing I would change is the bag that it comes in. Would be perfect if the bag came with a wider mouth so that once real is on you could use Storage bag for the both rod and reel :-)
customer_reviews.author: Prudent purchaser

customer_reviews.title: Its just not what I thought it would be in a surf rod
customer_reviews.text: This product is very cool looking but quickly looses its glamour the eyes pop off its really not good for sure fishing too light it would be better for jigging for pan fish it is very flexible and long just not made to cast heavy rigs
customer_reviews.author: James Walker

customer_reviews.title: This was a great purchase
customer_reviews.text: This rod handled the catfish of Lake Erie without a hitch. Excellent action and very flexible.
customer_reviews.author: Doc J

customer_reviews.title: Weak, broke far too easily
customer_reviews.text: This rod snapped on my first cast. Hooked a rock and did some reasonable tugging. The rod broke above the first line guide, snapped the carbon fiber. The 12 lb test should have failed far before the rod broke. Do not buy unless you are going for tiny fish.
customer_reviews.author: Erick VanMalssen

customer_reviews.title: Not perfect,but worth it
customer_reviews.text: end seems to like to stick in the extended position but with care can be pushed in all the way.
customer_reviews.author: Bearbarry

customer_reviews.title: Nice pole
customer_reviews.text: Appears to be well made. I used it jig fishing and it was ok. This is not my primary pole. This is for the trunk or suitcase so I will always have a pole available.
customer_reviews.author: 2m25

customer_reviews.title: The 12 ft rod needs to be thicker
customer_reviews.text: I went to Jamaica beach in san luis pass today. The rod to me seemed to flimsy for a 12 ft rod cause usually surf fishing requires a stiff rod. Didn't catch anything big but the rod did handle pretty good for the most part. I was using cut bait & a 6 oz weight which did bend the pole Alot but i made it work. Im giving it 3 stars cause i made it work & it didnt break
customer_reviews.author: jeffrey s yates

customer_reviews.title: Do not waste money on this pole
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for vacation in advance, and the first time using it the pole snapped in half while I was casting. The window for returns was closed and now I'm stuck with this broken pole and had to buy a new one on vacation. Do not waste money on this pole.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Fits in small places
customer_reviews.text: This part of what I was, hoped to be some new fishing equipment was easy to figure out. Not so with the two reels I also bought. With this kind of rod, though, you cannot just leave a hook on the end of the line and just tighten the reel on one of the loops, as in times of old
customer_reviews.author: Karl Thompson

customer_reviews.title: I bought this small 5'9 one and has worked perfectly fine. One of the rings came loose but you ...
customer_reviews.text: I had high expectations of this rod. I bought this small 5'9 one and has worked perfectly fine. One of the rings came loose but you can put it back in place. But when I bought the 8 footer, my rod snapped 1/4 from the top. It is disappointing because it broke on minor pressure applied and didn't get to use it on the fishing trip I went to. I'm willing to exchange it for a new one though because I really do like it.
customer_reviews.author: Exau

customer_reviews.title: GARBAGE!
customer_reviews.text: Complete Garbage!!! Broke after 1 use. Glue holding guides to rod is Elmers Kindergarten quality. Not consistent with the "most durable" teloscopic on the market. Considering the rod has the action of a crowbar indestructability was it's only draw. Well that was a hoax. I wouldn't recomend this cheap gimmick to anyone. BEWARE!!
customer_reviews.author: CholoSimeone

customer_reviews.title: Great travel surf rod
customer_reviews.text: I took this rod to gulf shores for the family vacation. Packs up small, easy to extend, performed well with little fish and excellently with a large sting ray. I’ve bought 2 so far surf fishing but they seem like they’d work for bank fishing for catfish and carp.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff the biology teacher

product_meta.title: Sougayilang Graphite Carbon Fiber Portable Spinning Telescopic Fishing Rod for Boat Saltwater and Freshwater
feature_bullets: The Sougayilang Telescoping Travel Spinning Fishing Rods Are Made of High Density 24 Ton Carbon Fiber and E-Glass Composite for Great Power and Sensitivity. It's Light Weight and Perfectly Balanced, Thus Less Fatigue. Great Gift for Our Fisherman!
The Exquisite Reel Seat Is Made of Corrosion Resistant CNC Machined Aluminum for Years of Worry Free Fishing.
Three Point Welded Stainless Steel Guides with Ceramic Inserts for Use with Braided or Mono Fishing Line and Providing Saltwater Approved Corrosion Resistant and Power Control.

Light Weight and Portable, Easily Fits In Car Trunk, Boat Hatch or Backpack. Sougayilang Telescopic Rods Allow You To Travel To Your Favorite Fishing Spot and Enjoy Fishing Whenever and Wherever You Want.
Various Sizes and Lengths Available for Freshwater Bass Trout Fishing, Saltwater Surf Fishing or Inshore Fishing.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
